encounter_1.speaker: janus_left
encounter_1.dialog: Greetings, Karen. What you’ve heard on the news is true, we are evacuating the earth via space elevator. Please take a left at the next intersection to evacuate.

encounter_1.speaker: karen
encounter_1.dialog: What the hell is going on here!? Where are you even sending us!? How do you know my name!?

encounter_1.speaker: janus_left
encounter_1.dialog: I’m sorry, I cannot divulge more information. If you would like to know more, please take a left at the next intersection.

encounter_1.speaker: karen
encounter_1.dialog: This is unbelievable, I’d like to speak to your ma-

encounter_1.speaker: janus_right
encounter_1.dialog: Greetings, Karen. What you’ve heard on the news is true, we are going to terraform the earth to make it habitable once more.

encounter_1.speaker: janus_right
encounter_1.dialog: There is a Billi’s chain restaurant to the North-East of our location if you would like to eat there one last time before it closes for good.

encounter_1.speaker: karen
encounter_1.dialog: Oh, are you kidding me? You were just telling me I should get outta here, now you’re telling me to relax? Who am I supposed to file my complaint to?

encounter_1.speaker: janus_right
encounter_1.dialog: I am sorry Karen, but I do not recall telling you to evacuate. I do not have clearance to give more information, however there is another Nowherian to the North East ready to tell you more about our program.

encounter_2.speaker: janus_left
encounter_2.dialog: Greetings, Karen. You’re our first customer today! You know, we already have all you need to survive aboard our state-of-the-art space station, the HMS Janus.

encounter_2.speaker: janus_left
encounter_2.dialog: We even have complimentary “I survived the end times!” T-Shirts, as per human traditio-

encounter_2.speaker: karen
encounter_2.dialog: I don’t WANT your damn T-Shirts, I want answers! Is the world really ending? Where are you taking us? Are you the one in charge around here?

encounter_2.speaker: janus_left
encounter_2.dialog: Apologies Karen, I am not at liberty to tell you more. Please take the next left if you still have questions.

encounter_2.speaker: karen
encounter_2.dialog: I’m never going to understand what’s going on, am I?

encounter_2.speaker: janus_right
encounter_2.dialog: We would like to offer you and your family the opportunity of a lifetime: front row seats to the restructuring of your world!

encounter_2.speaker: janus_right
encounter_2.dialog: You know, not many sentient beings get the chance to witness the rebirth of every ecosystem on their planet, this is a historic moment for your kind!

encounter_2.speaker: karen
encounter_2.dialog: I have had it up to HERE with you two-faced WEIRDOS. Just tell me where your boss is so I can get what I want!

encounter_2.speaker: janus_right
encounter_2.dialog: Please, calm down ma’am. We are doing what we can in these difficult times to secure a future for your people.

encounter_2.speaker: janus_right
encounter_2.dialog: I don’t understand what you mean by “two-faced,” or why you are so frustrated with me, but if you would like to know more please make a right at the next intersection.

encounter_3-1.speaker: karen
encounter_3-1.dialog: Ugh, finally! Are you the one in charge here?

encounter_3-1.speaker: janus_left
encounter_3-1.dialog: More or less. You gave my people quite a rinsing, from what I heard. I am the captain of the HMS Janus.

encounter_3-1.speaker: janus_right
encounter_3-1.dialog: And I am the project overseer behind the terraforming operation.

encounter_3-1.speaker: karen
encounter_3-1.dialog: You’re the only one I’ve met so far who can hear themselves talk, so you must be a bigshot.

encounter_3-1.speaker: karen
encounter_3-1.dialog: Don’t care. I’ve been driving so long now, I don’t even remember what I was confused about. I guess I just need to know where the hell I’m supposed to be right now.

encounter_3-1.speaker: janus_left
encounter_3-1.dialog: Well, that’s a complicated question. My colleague here is developing a selective terraforming process that’ll leave humanity intact while repairing much of the damage done to the ecosystems around the world.

encounter_3-1.speaker: janus_right
encounter_3-1.dialog: And this guy is trying to get you humans offworld in a giant space station while Earth is left to heal on its own.

encounter_3-1.speaker: janus_left
encounter_3-1.dialog: We elected to let humanity decide whether they’d prefer staying or leaving, and found that it’s a pretty even split. You’re the last one to show up, so you're the deciding factor here.

encounter_3-1.speaker: karen
encounter_3-1.dialog: I… this is all a lot to take in at once, I’m a little overwhelmed.

encounter_3-1.speaker: janus_right
encounter_3-1.dialog: Well you get what you ask for. You wanted answers, and this is as simple as it gets. So, make your decision. If you want me to go forward with terraforming Earth, take a right.

encounter_3-1.speaker: janus_left
encounter_3-1.dialog: And if you want me to take your people to space for the foreseeable future, take a left.

encounter_3-2.speaker: karen
encounter_3-2.dialog: Ugh, finally! Are you the one in charge here?

encounter_3-2.speaker: janus_left
encounter_3-2.dialog: More or less. You gave my people quite a rinsing, from what I heard. I am the captain of the HMS Janus.

encounter_3-2.speaker: janus_right
encounter_3-2.dialog: And I am the project overseer behind the terraforming operation.

encounter_3-2.speaker: karen
encounter_3-2.dialog: You’re the only one I’ve met so far who can hear themselves talk, so you must be a bigshot.

encounter_3-2.speaker: karen
encounter_3-2.dialog: Don’t care. I’ve been driving so long now, I don’t even remember what I was confused about. How do I get to the space elevator?

encounter_3-2.speaker: janus_left
encounter_3-2.dialog: I’m glad you asked, just take a left here and you’ll be right there.

encounter_3-2.speaker: janus_right
encounter_3-2.dialog: If you’ve changed your mind and would rather watch the world get terraformed, then you’ll have to turn back around and make your way to the right.

encounter_3-2.speaker: karen
encounter_3-2.dialog: If I wanted that, I would’ve asked.

encounter_3-3.speaker: karen
encounter_3-3.dialog: Ugh, finally! Are you the one in charge here?

encounter_3-3.speaker: janus_right

encounter_3-3.speaker: janus_left

encounter_3-3.speaker: karen

example.speaker: homer
example.dialog: Tell me, O muse, of that ingenious hero who travelled far and wide after he had sacked the famous town of Troy.

example.speaker: homer
example.dialog: Many cities did he visit, and many were the nations with whose manners and customs he was acquainted.

example.speaker: homer
example.dialog: Moreover he suffered much by sea while trying to save his own life and bring his men safely home.

example.speaker: homer
example.dialog: But do what he might he could not save his men, for they perished through their own sheer folly in eating the cattle of the Sun-god Hyperion.

example.speaker: homer
example.dialog: So the gods prevented them from ever reaching home.

example.speaker: homer
example.dialog: Tell me, too, about all these things, O daughter of Jove, from whatsoever source you may know them.

example.speaker: karen
example.dialog: See now, how men lay blame upon us gods for what is after all nothing but their own folly.

example.speaker: karen
example.dialog: Look at Aegisthus; he must needs make love to Agamemnon's wife unrighteously and then kill Agamemnon, though he knew it would be the death of him.

example.speaker: janus_left
example.dialog: Father, son of Saturn, King of kings, it served Aegisthus right, and so it would any one else who does as he did; but Aegisthus is neither here nor there.

example.speaker: janus_left
example.dialog: It is for Ulysses that my heart bleeds, when I think of his sufferings in that lonely sea-girt island, far away, poor man, from all his friends.

example.speaker: janus_right
example.dialog: My child, what are you talking about? How can I forget Ulysses than whom there is no more capable man on earth, nor more liberal in his offerings to the immortal gods that live in heaven?

example.speaker: janus_left
example.dialog: If, then, the gods now mean that Ulysses should get home, we should first send Mercury to the Ogygian island to tell Calypso that we have made up our minds and that he is to return.
